title: How to Make a Tsetse Fly Trap

steps.headline:
Use the blue material (piece C) as follows:Label the material A, B, C, D.{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/04\/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-1Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-1Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/04\/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-1Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-1Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}
Use the white netting (Piece D) as follows:Label the white netting material A, B, C, D and draw diagonal lines joining the points as shown.
Use the blue material (Piece A) as follows:Label the material A,B,C,D.
Use the black material (Piece B1) as follows:Label the material E1,F1,G1,H1 as shown.
Use the black material (Piece B2) as follows:Mark the material I1, J1, and L1.
Clear the selected trap site of any vegetation.
Determine the wind direction so as to site the trap facing the windward side.
Erect a back pole to guide in setting up of two-side poles.
steps.description: Firmly peg the back poles. Fasten the trap with pieces of wire to the back poles. Peg in the two side poles and fasten the trap so that the entrance faces the proper direction. Prepare the centre pole by fixing three nails of three inches each with a clearance of two inches each at the top and peg it firmly. Fix the netting on bottle top and support it by the nails at the top of the centre pole.

steps.headline: Fit the polythene cage at the apex of the erected trap and support the cage with strings stretched from thin sticks that are fastened on one of the side poles.
Firmly fix two containers, one for carrying attractant liquid substance (acetone) on the ground next to the back pole and the other for carrying cow urine.
steps.description: The attractant container should be covered with a lid that has a small aperture for slowing down the releasing odours as the attractant evaporates.

steps.headline: Fix transparent polythene bag to the top of the trap frame.
steps.description: The polythene bag is used as a cage for holding and suffocating tsetse flies. The sunlight attracts tsetse flies into the cage, which get killed by the heat from the sun. Dead flies in the cage or regularly disposed. For purposes of keeping records, tsetse fly catches are counted and recorded. The tsetse fly catches can also be sorted by age or sex for recording.

License: Creative Commons


"} From point F measure 1m and mark the point I. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet9-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet9-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet9-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet9-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} From point E measure 1m and mark the point J. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet10-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet10-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet10-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet10-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

"} From point J measure 1/2 m downwards and mark this point M.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet11-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet11-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet11-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet11-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons

License: Creative Commons


"} Repeat the same for point N as shown and mark it L.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet14-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet14-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet14-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet14-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Draw lines joining points J-K and I-L.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet15-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet15-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet15-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-3Bullet15-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use the black material (Piece B1) as follows:Label the material E1,F1,G1,H1 as shown. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Fit E1 to E, F1 to F, G1 to G, and H1 to H.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Staple along EG and FH. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet3-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet3-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-4Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use the black material (Piece B2) as follows:Mark the material I1, J1, and L1. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet1-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} From point L1 measure 6 inches (15.2 cm) and fold the flap using staples. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/af/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Repeat the same at point K1. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a5/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet3-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Fit J1 to J, I1 to I, K1 to K, L1 to L and staple along J-K and I-L.{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet4-Version-2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet4-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/61/Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet4-Version-2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Tsetse-Fly-Trap-Step-5Bullet4-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Join final product of step two to final product of step five with staples by fitting A C D to J X I. Clear the selected trap site of any vegetation. Determine the wind direction so as to site the trap facing the windward side. Erect a back pole to guide in setting up of two-side poles. Firmly peg the back poles. Fasten the trap with pieces of wire to the back poles. Peg in the two side poles and fasten the trap so that the entrance faces the proper direction. Prepare the centre pole by fixing three nails of three inches each with a clearance of two inches each at the top and peg it firmly. Fix the netting on bottle top and support it by the nails at the top of the centre pole. Fit the polythene cage at the apex of the erected trap and support the cage with strings stretched from thin sticks that are fastened on one of the side poles. Firmly fix two containers, one for carrying attractant liquid substance (acetone) on the ground next to the back pole and the other for carrying cow urine. The attractant container should be covered with a lid that has a small aperture for slowing down the releasing odours as the attractant evaporates. Fix transparent polythene bag to the top of the trap frame. The polythene bag is used as a cage for holding and suffocating tsetse flies. The sunlight attracts tsetse flies into the cage, which get killed by the heat from the sun. Dead flies in the cage or regularly disposed. For purposes of keeping records, tsetse fly catches are counted and recorded. The tsetse fly catches can also be sorted by age or sex for recording.
